intro: Stenomeria tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly stenomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
